citations.narrative:
An outdoor enclosure for a Patagonian Cavy had two wires with sharp points looped around the base of a wooden play
structure. This is a potential source of injury or entrapment to the enclosed animal. The sharp points need to be removed
or secured. All housing facilities shall be structurally sound and shall be maintained in good repair to protect the animals
from injury. This was addressed at the time of inspection.

The primary enclosure for an amazon parrot had a wire next to the food bowl with an exposed sharp point. There was
also an exposed wood screw in the wall next to an enrichment device. The primary enclosure for two emus in the walk
thru area of the park contained three wooden posts which had multiple exposed sharp points from various screws and
nails. Sharp points may cause injury and may lead to pain or discomfort to the animals. The primary enclosures must be
kept in good repair and have no sharp points or edges that could injure the birds. Corrected at the time of inspection on
August 14, 2024.

Watering
In the walk-through area of the facility an enclosure housing 2 emus had a dirty water receptacle that appears to have not
been cleaned or changed for at least several days. The water container appeared discolored and numerous live larvae
were present in the water supply. Potable water must be provided to every bird housed in the facility. Water receptacles
for birds must be cleaned and sanitized as often as necessary to keep them free from contamination. This was addressed
at the time of inspection.
This inspection was conducted on August 13 and August 14. The exit briefing was conducted on August 14.
Additional Inspectors:
MICHAEL TYGART, VETERINARY MEDICAL OFFICER n
